description: Rome's greatest orator, Cicero, was also its greatest prose stylist and the author most responsible for supplying Latin with philosophical vocabulary. Selections from his philosophical, rhetorical, and oratorical works show the range of his talents and help demonstrate the development of Latin prose style. Prerequisite: Latin 231 or equivalent. Offered every third year.
name: Cicero & Latin Prose
prerequisites: Prerequisite: Latin 231 or equivalent. Offered every third year.
title: Cicero and Latin Prose
